ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: This Arsha Bharathi Social Welfare Society was established as a voluntary organization during 1999. Our main aim is to serve the poorest human beings and children by promoting social awareness and removing stigma of poverty. Besides taking up several family welfare activities, conducting medical and health camps in rural areas since past Ten years, the society is striving its best to educate women and small farmers on income generation programmes. We are making efforts to establish residential instructions with vocational courses, adult education centers, libraries for girls of rural and slum areas to sensitize the downtrodden sections of society. This could be possible due to having good rapport with government departments and local community. This organization is planning to foster secularism and harmony among people through development programmes. Our endeavour is to ensure sustainable development, harmony, peace, and make the people self-reliant. We mainly focused on awareness programme on different local issues, few are illustrated here under â€¢ Consumer awareness camp â€¢ HIV/AIDS awareness camp â€¢ Income generation training â€¢ Special camp for adolescent girls of tribal areas. â€¢ Free tailoring training â€¢ Organic farming to small farmers â€¢ Adult education programme â€¢ Literacy awareness programme â€¢ Anti Arrack campaign â€¢ Pulse Polio camp â€¢ Health and Blood camp â€¢ Nutrition food to child labour â€¢ General awareness camp â€¢ Seminar against dowry, child and widow marriages â€¢ Shields to merit students â€¢ Clean and green programme at Medaram â€¢ Free eye and medical Camp â€¢ Chickengunya prevention programme â€¢ Cultural programmes for rural youth â€¢ Note books to poor students of SC & BC hostels. This society consists of mainly social workers, small land owners and philanthropists engaged in upliftment of rural weaker sections of this mandal. The objective of protecting the just born kids thrown in dustbins, railways and bus stations etc., Freed those neglected kids by curbing education will be fulfilled if the proposed institutions are built, for which land is being procured from government. Already necessary help is extending to physically handicapped, widows, orphans and senior citizens. As a part of our aims, we are celebrating national festivals like Independence day, Republic day, Birthday celebrations of great leaders who sacrificed their lives to nation like Rajiv Gandhi and celebrated Hindidiwas fortnight pakwara on 25.09.06 and distributed prizes to the winners in examination conducted in Hindi to students of local high school. This Society has organized 150 years First War of Indian Independence celebration. The beneficiaries of our training programmes are encouraging this society to conduct such income generation courses for some other rural youth. In our training programmes, local officials and resourceful persons were assisting and delivering their valuable suggestions to participants. In a year, the society is making efforts to construct own educational institutions at Abdullapue village, R.R dist to commence full-fledged orphan center, old aged home, vocational training institute and research institute to serve more voluntarily.

sourceOfFunds.purpose: The years 2015-18 has marked a significant progress in achieving the goals of the organisation, through organizing various innovative activities. Among these the major activities which has remarkably presented its impact are Awareness programmes, skill development programmes for unemployed youth, awareness camps on Employment generation, Entrepreneurship promotional activities, Youth welfare activities, Environmental awareness, Women empowerment programmes and child labour etc.

ARUNA FOUNDATIONorganized different programs for the sustainable development of environment under Swacch Bharath Prorgamme to promote Environmental education among the society. During this year, it has planted around 1000 saplings in the different district by organizing VANMAHAUTSAV and tree plantation camps. It has celebrated World Forestry Day, World Environment Day, World Ozone Depletion Day, International Biological Diversity Day etc to focus the Environment.

The major activities of ARUNA FOUNDATION org are creating environmental awareness across the rural farmers for promoting suitable livelihood opportunities and development for the young people of the rural areas of Andhra Pradesh. Apart from this Awareness generation activities on socio- economic, livelihood and environmental issues and Health issues through developing linkages with government and other institutions.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: APSA has been working on Child Rights and Child Protection since 1981 through institutional and outreach projects. The organization runs open shelters for children in distress, homes for young adults and trafficked girls, a youth skill training institute and a non-formal school â€“ all serving poor urban slum communities, in particular women and children. There are community-based projects to help migrant labourers, children, youth & women in slums through social, cultural and economic activities. Of APSAâ€™s staff, 75% are women with experience in work with children and youth. Among other organizational achievements of APSA are: 1) Member of ICPS Society for Karnataka state; presence on Child Welfare Committee of Bangalore district since 2009 2) Member of Drafting Committee of 8 NGOs involved in drafting the State child protection policy in educational institutions, and girl child protection policy 3) Open shelter â€˜Nammaneâ€™ awarded best child-friendly institution in the state (2012) 4) One of the NGOs running a shelter home and rehabilitation centre for adolescent girls and survivors of abuse in Bangalore city 5) Accompanies 2 of the 9 Special Juvenile Police Units, liaison with 39 police stations for more humane treatment of children found in conflict with the law 6) Involved in program to strengthen 15 School Development & Monitoring Committees in government schools in slum areas 7) Undertaken training for 5,000+ police personnel and over 3,000 staff of state government departments on child rights & child protection 8) Member State Committee for Urban Homeless, Right to Education Task Force, Taskforce on Alternative Care for Children Without Parental Care and Hospital-based Collaborative Child Response Unit for Abused Children 9) Member Central Advisory Committees on Child Labour and State Project Society for Eradication of Child Labour (2004-date) 10) Member, Bangalore Urban District National Child Labour Project (NCLP) Society (2008-date) 11) Collaborative partner of Childline India Foundation (1998 â€“ date). About 4,647 children have been helped (data for 7 years - 2010-2016) 12) Member of Anti-Alcohol NGO network in Hyderabad city 13) Collaborated with St. Johnâ€™s Research Institute (Hospital) in Bangalore to pioneer the use of mobile-based applications for addressing issue of domestic violence in slums (2013 â€“ date) 14) Award for Outstanding contribution to eradication of child labour, and Contribution to the field of Child Rights â€“ by State Dept. of Labour (2005, 2012) 15) Award for Outstanding contribution to holistic Child Welfare and Child Development â€“ by State DWCD (Nov. 2011) 16) Best NGO Award by Government of Telangana (2015)

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Youth For Action (YFA) has always promoted local institutions in the form of Sanghams, Federations and People based networks. The contributions to local institution development, promotion of democracy and local governance has yielded rich dividends in the form of people owned and promoted institutions We established the All India Federation of Women in Agriculture which, looks after the interest of small and marginal farmers. We provide a platform for interfacing of farmers and policy makers. On the other hand, it also assists women and men farmers in promoting livelihood strategies such as seed production, vegetable cultivation, dairy,oil seed production and watershed development. RIOD has emerged as a self-reliant networking organization of NGOs and CBOs in India. It was promoted by YFA and it undertakes various activities of awareness generation about UNCCD/RIO- Earth Summit, capacity building of NGOs and CBOs through training and exchange visits including governance of local institutions and have brought more than 1000 NGOs from the states like Andhra Pradesh, Karnataka, Tamilnadu, Orissa, Jharkhand, Bihar, Gujarat, Rajasthan, Maharashtra and Himachal Pradesh. Assisted more than 20,000 families and have established more than 4000 Sanghams i.e. womenâ€™s/peopleâ€™s institutions. Credit assistance provided to more than 10,000 families as a loan component for agribusiness and economic improvement activities. Assisted more than 6000 women and their children with reproductive and childhood health services. Regenerated at least 8000 ha of land through watershed management. Implemented about 1000 minor community irrigation wells benefiting more than 4000 families. Established on-farm research center in form of Krishi Vigyan Kendra in Mahaboobnagar district, Andhra Pradesh and a farmerâ€™s training centre in Gurumitkal village, Gulbarga district, Karnataka. Constructed more than 300 houses and 10 community centres and established 2 building production centres. Established larger number of nurseries for generating income through horticulture and vegetable cultivation. Established bio-technology center as a resource unit for promoting and hardening of plants like teak and neem and also vermicompost demonstration centre. Established information dissemination centre including an agro-service centre for local market

The number of farmers associated with the project rose from less than 200 in year 2011 to 4500 now in year 2017.
